application_protocol.name: furniture_catalog_and_interior_design
application_protocol.title: Furniture catalog and interior design
application_protocol.purpose: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application protocol for the representation of furniture catalogs and of the data managed during the design of pieces of furniture and during the study of their inclusion in rooms
application_protocol.keywords: STEP, ISO 10303, module, furniture product, interior design, catalog, expressions

abstract.li: This document includes the scope of the AP module and provides a planning model and conformance class information.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application protocol for the representation of furniture catalogs and of the data managed during the design of pieces of furniture and during the study of their inclusion in rooms. It satisfies an industrial need to exchange and to integrate product data with furniture decoration projects.

This part of ISO 10303 provides a comprehensive capability to describe a set of furniture products specified by its variants and price list that could be choose by retailers to provide specific pieces of furniture to its customer.
Further modules are included to support the representation of structured requirements.

This part of ISO 10303 (funStep application protocol) provides a comprehensive vision about furniture product data catalogs exchange between furniture manufacturers and furniture retaillers/distributors.
The funStep vision is shown in Figure 1.
The vision shows how relevant information required for furniture products catalogues can be managed in an integrated form. This data can be decomposed in three main components:

ul.li: the product data structure that represents simple and complex products bill of materials (BOM);
the product specifications that specifies the different variant combinations a product is allowed to have before beeing sold;
and the building room specification where furniture products could fit.

purpose.p: A data planning model which develops these concepts is presented in .

This part of ISO 10303 can be used to develop standardized interfaces between software applications used in furniture catalogue development and retaillers furniture decoration projects design. These may include:

ul.li: point-to-point interfaces between two systems with similar capability which are using different application software;
point-to-point interfaces between systems with different capability, but some common data;
an integrated series of interfaces required to realize the PLCS vision across many different systems supporting a major asset.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 is constructed using the ISO 10303 application modules. It is therefore harmonized with other application protocols that use the same modules. This part of ISO 10303 uses the application modules which were developed to achieve harmonization between application protocols ISO 10303-203, ISO 10303-214, ISO 10303-233 and ISO 10303-239, for product data management information (the "PDM Modules").
Through common modules, this part of ISO 10303 is harmonized in the following areas:

ul.li: with part ISO 10303-214 for product structures through the PDM modules;
with part ISO 10303-203 Edition 2 for the representation of assembly structure, properties and characterization concepts such as date/time, approval and person-organization;
with parts ISO-10303-239 for the classification and the use of reference data.

purpose.p: The requirements management capability in this part of ISO 10303 was developed jointly with the project developing a new application protocol for System Engineering under the new workm item project ISO 10303-233.
The precise harmonization achieved can be determined from scope of the common modules. Further information on the modules, and the relationship to other application protocols is provided in .

definition.def: The information that constitutes a specification sufficient for the evaluation and manufacturing of a decorated room.
The information that constitutes a specification sufficient for the evaluation of a furniture catalogue in order to completely understand all the features, rules and restrictions involved.
The information that constitutes a specification sufficient for the evaluation and understanding of a decorated room or set of rooms.
A subset of products in a catalogue that share some specific features, rules or restrictions.

abbreviation.term: specialised CAD systems for furniture editing and furnishing interior design projecting

description.p: A furniture catalog contains a list of references of pieces of furniture that are proposed to customers or to distributors.
A catalog provides a commercial view of the products of a furniture supplier but it does not represent the design information of the pieces of furniture.
This application protocol enables to represent both kinds of information, using distinct data structures.

description.p: An exchange structure shall be encoded in a file conforming to the syntax and EXPRESS language mapping defined in ISO 10303-21 and to the AIM schema defined in annex A of this part of ISO 10303.
The FILE_SCHEMA element of the header shall specify the name of the Express schema used and include its object information identifier (see annex D).
